So what is it? In simple terms, it's what you would expect to see.
So let's take a basic example of a breakout trade.
Now in a breakout trade, we expect to see a pick-up in volume, a pick-up in the volatility,
and a little bit of initiation from either the buyers or sellers.
These are our expectations.
So if we take on a breakout strategy and we do not see these expectations, so maybe we
see a lot of two-way trade on a breakout, that is telling us straight away that this
strategy is not playing out according to our expectations.
Now again, a lot of the time these expectations can actually get us out of good trades,
and that is why we have an expectation analysis.
